intro: Citharexylum ekmanii, commonly known as the New Zealand honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its fragrant, tubular flowers are usually white or pale yellow, appearing in clusters. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
